titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to clarify the authority of the Secretary of Defense to transfer to Federal and State agencies excess personal property of the Department of Defense suitable for use in law enforcement.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Readiness.

bill.summary: 2/23/1999--Introduced. Authorizes the Secretary of Defense to transfer the following excess defense materials to Federal and State agencies for law enforcement activities: (1) small arms, ammunition, protective equipment, vehicles, and other personal property with a direct application to such activities; and (2) personal property intended to enhance the training, safety, or working conditions of law enforcement officers.
